title: Texas Public Information Act Request – Records Related to Prosecutors Amdur and Willborn representing the State of Texas (Texas Secretary of State)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act (Tex. Gov’t Code § 552), I respectfully request access to and copies of all records related to the following individuals in their official capacities:

1. Assistant District Attorney Jonathan Amdur
State Bar No.: 24015033

2. District Attorney David Willborn
State Bar No.: 24033458

This request pertains specifically to their involvement in the investigation and prosecution of Bobin Thomas George, and any cases or legal proceedings related to the following docket or case numbers:

F25-007-J3

24-1568-CV-E

25-1922-CV-E

25-0672-CR-E

25-0673-CR-E

25-2038-CR-B

I request the following categories of records, including but not limited to:

Emails, memos, letters, texts, or any correspondence (internal or external) referencing Bobin Thomas George or the above case numbers

Internal prosecutorial notes, briefing materials, witness interviews, and investigation files

Affidavits submitted, requested, or reviewed by the prosecutors

Communications between the prosecutors and law enforcement or any court officials

Any Brady/Giglio disclosures or records of exculpatory evidence considered

Disciplinary records, complaints, sanctions, or grievances filed with the Texas State Bar or internal HR departments

Any documents related to prosecutorial misconduct, bias, or conflict of interest

Training records, performance evaluations, or reprimands

Records of any communications with defense counsel regarding plea deals or discovery disclosures

Video/audio recordings (e.g., body cam, jail calls, interviews) reviewed, omitted, or cited by the prosecution

Notes or communications about compliance or non-compliance with discovery obligations

If any portion of the records is exempt from disclosure, please cite the specific exemption and provide redacted versions of all non-exempt materials as required by law.

Please provide responsive documents electronically if available. If the request will incur costs, kindly inform me in advance with an itemized estimate.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mathew George
